00059 
00060 EGS_UnionGeometry::EGS_UnionGeometry(const vector<EGS_BaseGeometry *> &geoms,
00061                                      const int *priorities, const string &Name) :
00062     EGS_BaseGeometry(Name) {
00063     ng = geoms.size();
00064     if (ng <= 0) egsFatal("EGS_UnionGeometry::EGS_UnionGeometry: attempt "
00065                               " to construct a union geometry from zero geometries\n");
00066     is_convex = false;
00067     if (ng == 1) egsWarning("EGS_UnionGeometry::EGS_UnionGeometry: why "
00068                                 "do you want to make a union out of a single geometry?\n");
00069     g = new EGS_BaseGeometry* [ng];
00070     nmax = 0;
00071     int j;
00072     int *order = new int [ng];
00073     if (priorities) {
00074         // user has definied priorities
00075         // order them using a very simplistic algorithm
00076         bool *is_used = new bool [ng];
00077         for (j=0; j<ng; j++) {
00078             is_used[j] = false;
00079         }
00080         for (j=0; j<ng; j++) {
00081             int imax;
00082             for (imax=0; imax<ng-1; imax++) if (!is_used[imax]) {
00083                     break;
00084                 }
00085             int pmax = priorities[imax];
00086             for (int i=0; i<ng; i++) {
00087                 if (!is_used[i] && priorities[i] > pmax) {
00088                     imax = i;
00089                     pmax = priorities[i];
00090                 }
00091             }
00092             order[j] = imax;
00093             is_used[imax] = true;
00094         }
00095         delete [] is_used;
00096     }
00097     else {
00098         // user has not definied priorities
00099         for (j=0; j<ng; j++) {
00100             order[j] = j;
00101         }
00102     }
00103     has_rho_scaling = false;
00104     // now put the geometries into the array of geometries in
00105     // decreasing priority order.
00106     for (j=0; j<ng; j++) {
00107         int i = order[j];
00108         g[i] = geoms[j];
00109         g[i]->ref();
00110         int n = g[i]->regions();
00111         if (n > nmax) {
00112             nmax = n;
00113         }
00114         if (!has_rho_scaling) {
00115             has_rho_scaling = g[i]->hasRhoScaling();
00116         }
00117     }
00118     delete [] order;
00119     if (!nmax) egsFatal("EGS_UnionGeometry::EGS_UnionGeometry: all geometries"
00120                             " have zero regions?\n");
00121     nreg = nmax*ng;
00122 }
00123 
00124 EGS_UnionGeometry::~EGS_UnionGeometry() {
00125     for (int j=0; j<ng; j++) {
00126         if (!g[j]->deref()) {
00127             delete g[j];
00128         }
00129     }
00130     delete [] g;
00131 }

00133 void EGS_UnionGeometry::printInfo() const {
00134     EGS_BaseGeometry::printInfo();
00135     egsInformation(" geometries:\n");
00136     for (int j=0; j<ng; j++) egsInformation("   %s (type %s)\n",
00137                                                 g[j]->getName().c_str(),g[j]->getType().c_str());
00138     egsInformation(
00139         "=======================================================\n");
00140 }

00142 extern "C" {
00143 
00144     EGS_UNIONG_EXPORT EGS_BaseGeometry *createGeometry(EGS_Input *input) {
00145         if (!input) {
00146             egsWarning("createGeometry(union): null input?\n");
00147             return 0;
00148         }
00149         vector<EGS_BaseGeometry *> geoms;
00150         vector<string> gnames;
00151         int err = input->getInput("geometries",gnames);
00152         if (err || gnames.size() < 1) {
00153             egsWarning("createGeometry(union): missing/wrong 'geometries' input\n");
00154             return 0;
00155         }
00156         for (unsigned int j=0; j<gnames.size(); j++) {
00157             EGS_BaseGeometry *gj = EGS_BaseGeometry::getGeometry(gnames[j]);
00158             if (!gj) egsWarning("createGeometry(union): no geometry named %s "
00159                                     "defined\n",gnames[j].c_str());
00160             else {
00161                 geoms.push_back(gj);
00162             }
00163         }
00164         if (geoms.size() < 1) {
00165             egsWarning("createGeometry(union): must have at least one geometry\n");
00166             return 0;
00167         }
00168         vector<int> pri;
00169         err = input->getInput("priorities",pri);
00170         int *p = 0;
00171         if (!err) {
00172             if (pri.size() == geoms.size()) {
00173                 p = new int [pri.size()];
00174                 for (int i=0; i<pri.size(); i++) {
00175                     p[i] = pri[i];
00176                 }
00177             }
00178             else egsWarning("createGeometry(union): the number of priorities (%d)"
00179                                 " is not the same as the number of geometries (%d) => ignoring\n",
00180                                 pri.size(),geoms.size());
00181         }
00182         EGS_BaseGeometry *result = new EGS_UnionGeometry(geoms,p);
00183         result->setName(input);
00184         result->setLabels(input);
00185         if (p) {
00186             delete [] p;
00187         }
00188         return result;
00189     }
00190 
00191     void EGS_UnionGeometry::getLabelRegions(const string &str, vector<int> &regs) {
00192 
00193         // label defined in the sub-geometries
00194         vector<int> gregs;
00195         int shift=0;
00196         for (int i=0; i<ng; i++) {
00197 
00198             // add regions from set geometries
00199             gregs.clear();
00200             if (g[i]) {
00201                 g[i]->getLabelRegions(str, gregs);
00202             }
00203 
00204             // shift region numbers according to indexing style
00205             for (int j=0; j<gregs.size(); j++) {
00206                 gregs[j] += i*nmax;
00207             }
00208 
00209             // add regions to the list
00210             regs.insert(regs.end(), gregs.begin(), gregs.end());
00211 
00212         }
00213 
00214         // label defined in self (union geometry input block)
00215         EGS_BaseGeometry::getLabelRegions(str, regs);
00216 
00217     }
00218
